channel.title: How is this Possible? (Java bots)
channel.description:
This is so weird, there are bots all over Runescape, and no one knows where they came from, does anyone have any information on this?
Go on free worlds, Yew Trees below Fally, Draynor Willows, Lumby swamps.
Where are they coming from? This is not SCAR, because there is 3-6 at each spot, on several worlds, and not that many people use one SCAR script at one time.
The only thing I can think of? -Java bot made by someone here.. -Autorune was actually released. -Secret private java bot was made. (But wouldn't more members no about it here?)
Enlighten me please, and check it out.

item.title: How is this Possible? (Java bots)
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

[quote=“thiefmn6092, post:36, topic:3333”][quote author=Cheesehunk link=topic=3911.msg38457#msg38457 date=1148694830]
This is so weird, there are bots all over Runescape, and no one knows where they came from, does anyone have any information on this?

Go on free worlds, Yew Trees below Fally, Draynor Willows, Lumby swamps.

Where are they coming from? This is not SCAR, because there is 3-6 at each spot, on several worlds, and not that many people use one SCAR script at one time.

The only thing I can think of?
-Java bot made by someone here…
-Autorune was actually released.
-Secret private java bot was made. (But wouldn’t more members no about it here?)

Enlighten me please, and check it out.

[/quote]

The only thing that might be “secret” is I heard about some C++ shit being made, No idea what that is about though.[/quote]

This is a very old thread. “Whothe0” bumped it up with useless spam for no reason.

Read full topic

item.title: How is this Possible? (Java bots)
item.dc:creator: @VG_Kobra VG_Kobra
item.description:
@VG_Kobra wrote:

PaulT:

[quote]Might be sarcasm, but it is the western attitude toward just about everything…Americans particularly.

Yeah. We’re conditioned from birth to believe we’re conditioned from birth to exist in a culture of victimhood, if you know what I mean ;).

That’s nothing I’ve seen a guy divide 22 by 7 and state the digits 2500+ places, Some people are just born for math. I’m born for screwing up at math.

I think the culture you grow up in and the teachers and school you go to, is more important than your genes. When my father was a boy he was third in his country in math competitions. He ended up being a theoretical physcisist, and just recently he has written a compression algorithm that is quite possibly the best in the world. And I just dropped out of highschool, with an F in math at time of departure. I can understand the Runescape client better than I could ever understand my textbooks, but I guess my point is really, everyone is born with alot of potential in something, but you can channel it into anything you want.[/quote]

Ironic isn’t it? When a Math dud is born to a Math Genius. It makes you rethink about hereditry…

Read full topic

I can understand the Runescape client better than I could ever understand my textbooks, but I guess my point is really, everyone is born with alot of potential in something, but you can channel it into anything you want.[/quote]

My skill is school, and sports…

@PaulT wrote:

Might be sarcasm, but it is the western attitude toward just about everything...Americans particularly.

Yeah. We’re conditioned from birth to believe we’re conditioned from birth to exist in a culture of victimhood, if you know what I mean ;).

That's nothing I've seen a guy divide 22 by 7 and state the digits 2500+ places, Some people are just born for math. I'm born for screwing up at math.

I think the culture you grow up in and the teachers and school you go to, is more important than your genes. When my father was a boy he was third in his country in math competitions. He ended up being a theoretical physcisist, and just recently he has written a compression algorithm that is quite possibly the best in the world. And I just dropped out of highschool, with an F in math at time of departure. I can understand the Runescape client better than I could ever understand my textbooks, but I guess my point is really, everyone is born with alot of potential in something, but you can channel it into anything you want.

item.title: How is this Possible? (Java bots)
item.dc:creator: @VG_Kobra VG_Kobra
item.description:
@VG_Kobra wrote:

[quote=“PaulT, post:4, topic:3333”][quote author=theghost14 link=topic=3911.msg38579#msg38579 date=1148704521]

I’ve heard of a South Korean runescape cheating community, but it might have been rumours.

And they happen to be more smarter then us
[/quote]

They are much smarterer.

I was watching TV a few hours ago and they had a show about these kids in South Korea who were learning to use an abacus (a simple calculator tool made of sliding beads and wood, if you don’t know) from an extremely early age, and by the time they are 12, they can simply imagine the abacus in their hand and make the motions of moving the abacus, and multiply vast numbers in their head. :O[/quote]

That’s nothing I’ve seen a guy divide 22 by 7 and state the digits 2500+ places, Some people are just born for math. I’m born for screwing up at math.

Read full topic

item.description:
@philip_l_g wrote:

dual log in is easy just select one account on unsigned java applet at detail select and a signed one for another acc and all you need is a mouse recording macro to select the runescape programs from your taskbar and cut yews… if thats what you mean?

yeah whos smarter now,

and dont belive the shit u see on tv

item.title: How is this Possible? (Java bots)
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Krichevskoy, post:22, topic:3333”][quote author=Cheesehunk link=topic=3911.msg38644#msg38644 date=1148707564]

How about, we all move to another game and hack the Sh*t out of it since RS has already updated their Engine

Yeah. This is hard and stuff. Let’s all give up.

Yes, everyone give up now.
[/quote]

Might be sarcasm, but it is the western attitude toward just about everything…Americans particularly.

There’s also rumours going on about a runescape hacking/cheating group in South Korea Thats what people keep saying at SRl but I highly doubt it.

I’ve wondered how long it would take for someone besides this little ring of communities we have to figure out that RuneScape anti-cheating sucks.[/quote]

hey, Im american and I never give up ;D

and who says SCAR has to use your mouse? it doesnt technically, there are other ways, and if all goes well Ill be releasing something soon so that you can auto as many characters as your computer can handle with SCAR

item.title: How is this Possible? (Java bots)
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

Dizzy:

My thoughts is they (whoever), have a program like SCAR, but instead of bitmaps or colors (DTM’s also), they have the program click on models. The reason I’m saying this is because I know that’s how SCAR will be soon (if someone ever updates it). Another reason is because someone here (forgot name) has made a model viewer already (that’s one step closer to a macro that looks for models instead of colors).

Nah, the Minimap automatically rotates, the only way to stop that is by making a bot that stops it, which would require deobing the client…

Read full topic

item.title: How is this Possible? (Java bots)
item.dc:creator: @ipl0x ipl0x
item.description:
@ipl0x wrote:

Dizzy:

My thoughts is they (whoever), have a program like SCAR, but instead of bitmaps or colors (DTM’s also), they have the program click on models. The reason I’m saying this is because I know that’s how SCAR will be soon (if someone ever updates it). Another reason is because someone here (forgot name) has made a model viewer already (that’s one step closer to a macro that looks for models instead of colors).

Whats the difference between model and colour searching macro? Wouldn’t you still be using only 1 account since the mouse is required? And besides wouldn’t you have to client hack in order to use model macro since you’ll be looking for models instead of colours?

Read full topic
